item.description:
Making Progress!

This week was a very productive week for our wedding preparations. On Thuesday we booked our Honeymoon! I won't publish the destination yet but the picture here will give you a hint.. Further more we're going to do a 'wedding-course' with an already married couple (2 friends of us). We had dinner at their house on Monday and they offered us the course. Such a course will certainly help us grow in our relation. It is a 5 evening course where we probably hear a lot of things we never tought of.
Honeymoon beach
posted by Joeri Mulder at 8:01 PM | link

Hay Fever

Seasons is starting again. On Sunday I was hit by hay fever. It totally drained my energy while I hadn't medicine available. At home I have a rather new medicine called Aerius, an antihistamine. Meanwhile I subscribed to a 'pollenbulletin' which reports on pollen in the air. I'm still figuring out which pollen I'm actually allergic too (trees, grasses or weeds). On Sunday 13-4-2003 the pollenbulletin reported a high concentrate of 'birke pollen'. posted by Joeri Mulder at 11:40 AM | link

Codec

I got some response back that the movie is not shown on all computers. This seems to be a AVI codec issue which I'll try to resolve a.s.a.p. posted by Joeri Mulder at 7:08 PM | link

Preperations

Yesterday we worked very hard to get our 'Wish-list' ready. It's a custom in Switzerland to have a 'Hochzeits Wunschliste', a book (in our case accompanied with a website) with all the presents that we wish for our wedding. The idea is that the book is distributed to the guests who select a present (or part of it) they want to give us. This way we don't get any duplicate gifts and people can give things that we're really interested in.

The whole day we went to a shop called 'Jelmoli'. This shop offers a free service to build such a Wunschliste. In return you have to buy all your gifts from them ofcourse. We selected our cutlery, service and glasses. In about 3 or 4 weeks a website will be up and our book will be ready which will present our gifts and you will be able to make a gift! We'll keep you posted! posted by Joeri Mulder at 7:11 PM | link

Fun in the snow

Let's see if I can post a nice movie of Regina playing in the snow.


posted by Joeri Mulder at 6:55 PM | link

Almost over

Our holiday is almost over again. The last two days it snowed a lot and sight is minimal. We stayed inside and worked on our tasklist for the wedding. Ofcourse there is also time for some relaxing and a game of Age of Empires. Tomorrow we'll be leaving again and pick up our normal rythm. We definately had a great time here and are already looking forward to our Honeymoon!
Regina drinking some tea on a little hike
posted by Joeri Mulder at 12:40 PM | link
